channel.title: Divine Server help
channel.description:
Okay, well im not new at java or rs2 servers.. but im new at rsc servers, so dont hate me for those questions :)
i just got the devinePk server, and i got it online now, my friends can join and everything is running.. But..
First of all: when i log in i get thiss chat message: welcome to devine blahblah.. I found out that in this folder: Divine pk v5.0\Server\conf\defs\extras\Adverts.xml theres a file called Adverts.xml. and then i changed welcome to devine blahblah... to something else. then i delete the old Adverts.xml.gz file and zip the new file to Adverts.xml.gz Then i run the compile.bat in server folder.. and run server..
but nothing happends? theres no changes on server..
i had to change some monster drops to, so i did the same with \Divine pk v5.0\Server\conf\defs\extras\DropDef.xml
can anyone help here, or tell me where to get help? :)
sorry if this is pissing you off

item.title: Divine Server help
item.dc:creator: @kubert kubert
item.description:
@kubert wrote:

didnt work either, this is soo wierd…

do i have to do anything with wamp? never used wamp before

i dont have to change anything in Divine pk v5.0\Server\build
just in Divine pk v5.0\Server\conf
right?

im really confused, i must be doing something wrong, but all seems to be right[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 10, 2008, 01:26:37 PM[/size][hr]IT WORKS… i dont know what happend, but it works now :s

sry for trouble

Read full topic

@adu wrote:

I use 7-zip, works wonders.

@kubert wrote:

i think i found out what ive been doing wrong, maybe its my 7-z program that is doing something wrong… ill try with a new program…

item.title: Divine Server help
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

Are you compressing your edited xml file back to a xml.gz format?

And yes adverts.xml folder is just a backup

Read full topic

item.title: Divine Server help
item.dc:creator: @kubert kubert
item.description:
@kubert wrote:

ok listen… this is wierd…
in this folder:
Divine pk v5.0\Server\conf\defs\extras
theres a file called Adverts.xml.gz
and if i unzip it theres a file called Adverts.xml wich i changed the welcome message in…

So then i use compile.bat and run server… but no changes :s

what do i need to have in this folder
Divine pk v5.0\Server\conf\defs\extras\Adverts.xml
is that one just for backups or something?

Read full topic

item.title: Divine Server help
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

you probably didn’t replace the existing one there.

Read full topic

item.title: Divine Server help
item.dc:creator: @i_pk_pjers_i i_pk_pjers_i
item.description:
@i_pk_pjers_i wrote:

[quote=“kubert, post:3, topic:219020”]so now i got this file
Divine pk v5.0\Server\conf\defs\extras\Adverts.xml.gz and inside that gz file there is Adverts.xml

it still doesnt work :s[/quote]copy the adverts.xml.gz from adverts.xml, then paste in in the extras folder, restart the server and it should work.

Read full topic

item.title: Divine Server help
item.dc:creator: @kubert kubert
item.description:
@kubert wrote:

so now i got this file
Divine pk v5.0\Server\conf\defs\extras\Adverts.xml.gz and inside that gz file there is Adverts.xml

it still doesnt work :s

Read full topic

item.title: Divine Server help
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

Alright, i think i might know what the porblem is here.

You see, the server reads the xml.gz files from \Divine pk v5.0\Server\conf\defs\extras not the gz file in ie - Divine pk v5.0\Server\conf\defs\extras\Adverts.xml

Fix- All you gotta do is paste the gz file in Divine pk v5.0\Server\conf\defs\extras, then run the server

Any more questions, please post here.

ps- all those folders in Divine pk v5.0\Server\conf\defs\extras are useless, all you really need is the gz files there.

Read full topic
